channel.title: Skills[delta]
channel.description:
dear moparscapers,
I have coded a server before and got to a point where it said code too large. To not let this happen again i want to make my skills in a different java file. So i mean you put thieving in a file called thieving. But how can i make it that the jave file will be connected with client.java where it normally need to be put in?
thanks, halflive9

item.title: Skills[delta]
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:6, topic:384742”]Lol, you really must have raped your client class.

onTopic; Tatemo is right, if you don’t even know what packaging is you really shouldn’t be working on skills, but nevertheless I have a feeling that you are going to go ahead and attempt to create it anyway, and end up with a huge class the size of my penis.
Any who, this code should work; if you don’t even know how to add it, just don’t bother with the new class:

[code=java] private client c;

public Thieving(client client) 
{
		this.c = client;
}[/code][/quote]

uhm well, as i see tatemo had a cleaned delta and packaged it and got already a class prayer i would like to know how he did it there.

Read full topic

item.title: Skills[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Lol, you really must have raped your client class.

onTopic; Tatemo is right, if you don’t even know what packaging is you really shouldn’t be working on skills, but nevertheless I have a feeling that you are going to go ahead and attempt to create it anyway, and end up with a huge class the size of my penis.
Any who, this code should work; if you don’t even know how to add it, just don’t bother with the new class:

[code=java] private client c;

public Thieving(client client) 
{
		this.c = client;
}[/code]

Read full topic

@halflive9 wrote:

Well, i think it isn’t packaged. I downloaded ur cleaned delta and that brought me on the idea .

item.title: Skills[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Go read some tutorials. You shouldn’t be adding skills if you don’t even know how to tell the difference between packaged and non-packaged.

Read full topic
